text.__SUMMARY__: Acacia repanda is a shrub belonging to the genus Acacia and the subgenus Juliflorae. It is native to a small area in the southern Wheatbelt region of Western Australia.The rounded to obconic shrub typically grows to a height of 0.5 to 2 metres (2 to 7 ft). It blooms from June to August producing yellow flowers. The single stemmed and multi-branched plant has minni-ritchi bark
